intro: Sanicula gregaria, commonly known as the clustered sanicle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Sanicula gregaria is known for its clustered growth habit and its ability to thrive in woodland soils.
